issue.title: Instead of getting automation relevance and applying raw patches, just pull

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
For autoland, we don't really need to do the same as try, as we are sure pushes are correctly ordered. So, we could just pull from the remote repository instead of getting the list of patches to apply using json-automationrelevance and getting the raw contents from hgmo.

Could help with #1422.

issue.title: Check if the Mercurial operations we perform in clean are all needed

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
For example, in `repository.apply_stack` we currently do:
- hg.revert(repo_dir, all=True)
- hglib.util.cmdbuilder(b"strip", rev=b"roots(outgoing())", force=True, backup=False)
- hg.update(base, clean=True)

Are all these operations needed?

body:
Logs from recent classifications. We're down to between 40 seconds and 1 minute and 40 seconds:

issue.title: Use a single rust-code-analysis API call to get both functions and metrics

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body: The function information is already available in the metrics API call result, so there's no need to do two API calls.

issue.title: Don't hit hgmo to get automationrelevance for a given push

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
If we do #1433, instead of getting automationrelevance from a remote hgmo repo, we can get it from a locally running hgmo.
Or, we could try to add a command to version-control-tools to get automationrelevance without running the server.

Could help with #1422.

issue.title: For try, can we avoid downloading and applying the patch containing try_task_config.json?

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

body:
#1453 and, especially, #1433 helped:
